text: Involvement of an SAF-like transcription factor in the activation of <extra_id_0> serum amyloid A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in monocyte / macrophage cells by lipopolysaccharide .

text: <extra_id_0> Serum amyloid A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> SAA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) has been linked to atherosclerosis because of its ability to remodel high - density lipoprotein by the depletion of apolipoprotein A1 , its ability to bind cholesterol , and its presence in the atherosclerotic plaques of coronary and carotid arteries .

text: In the present study , we investigated the induction mechanism of <extra_id_0> SAA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene in THP-1 monocyte / macrophage cells which play a critical role in the development of atherosclerotic fatty streak and plaque formation .
We and others have shown that <extra_id_0> SAA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is induced in monocyte / macrophage cells by lipopolysaccharide ( LPS ) .
By promoter function analysis , we show that the <extra_id_0> SAA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter sequence between -280 and -226 can confer LPS responsiveness .
Gel electrophoretic mobility shift assay detected an induced DNA - binding activity in these cells in response to LPS .

Characterization of the DNA - binding protein by UV cross-linking , Southwestern blot , and antibody ablation / supershift assays revealed that it is similar to a recently reported nuclear factor designated SAF .
These results demonstrated that LPS - mediated <extra_id_0> SAA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene induction in monocyte / macrophage cells is primarily due to the induction of SAF activity .
